moves.4. Nxd4: Capturing the knight here is known as the Paulson variation
moves.4... exd4 5. O-O: It's easy to see white's advantage in this opening line - Complete kingside development before black has even begun his!
moves.5... g6: Probably not the best idea. Fiancettoing here takes longer to develop, and weakens dark squares. A better try might be 5... Bc5, or 5.. Qh4
moves.6. d3 Bg7 7. Qf3 Qf6 8. Qg3 Qb6 9. Na3 c: Black has been trying to keep the initiative by forcing me to respond to threats. He has missed the "neat" move here that instantly gives me all initiative, though!
moves.10. Nc4 Qc5: Of course, we wouldn't want to see Qxb5 Nd6+
moves.12... Nf6 13. e5: Opening the E-file is clearly fatal for black. With all my pieces swarming, a rook on the file of his king will be the final straw.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
